body: I have found that I can only run the spack compiled module of Julia on the same family Intel CPU it was compiled on. It complains if you run on any other family. "ERROR: Target architecture mismatch. Please delete or regenerate sys.{so,dll,dylib}." I have compiled on our oldest family (Nahalem). Based on my experience with compiling R on my cluster (non-Spack) by compiling on the oldest family, it will run everywhere. This was not the case with the Julia package.
title: Julia package builds only run on the x86_64 CPU family they were compiled on
